    • Method Detail

      • joinWith

        public static final <KEY,LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> rx.Observable.Transformer<LEFT_VALUE,RESULT> joinWith(rx.Observable<RIGHT_VALUE> rightHandSide,
                                                                                                              java.util.Comparator<KEY> ordering,
                                                                                                              rx.functions.Func1<? super LEFT_VALUE,KEY> leftHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                                                              rx.functions.Func1<? super RIGHT_VALUE,KEY> rightHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                                                              rx.functions.Func2<LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> joinFunction,
                                                                                                              JoinType joinType)
        Returns a Transformer which performs a SQL join on sorted streams. There are three join types supported: full inner, full outer, and left. In case of duplicates, as in SQL, a product will be applied on the output. Used with the Observable.compose(rx.Observable.Transformer<? super T, ? extends R>) method to provide method chaining. This operator uses "reactive pull" backpressure to slow down the source observable in case it's over producing. This means the source of data from this stream should support backpressure. The easiest way to do this is to model it as an Iterable or Generator, or if this isn't possible, to use SyncOnSubscribe in the Observable.create method.
        Parameters:
        rightHandSide - the observable to join against
        ordering - a comparator which specifies the relative ordering of both streams
        leftHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        rightHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        joinFunction - a function which join the values from the two streams
        joinType - the type of join to perform -- left, outer, and inner
        Returns:
        the joined observable

      • join

        public static final <KEY,LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> rx.Observable<RESULT> join(rx.Observable<LEFT_VALUE> leftHandSide,
                                                                                   rx.Observable<RIGHT_VALUE> rightHandSide,
                                                                                   java.util.Comparator<KEY> ordering,

                                                                                   JoinType joinType)
        Returns a Transformer which performs a SQL join on sorted streams. There are three join types supported: full inner, full outer, and left. In case of duplicates, as in SQL, a product will be applied on the output. Used with the Observable.compose(rx.Observable.Transformer<? super T, ? extends R>) method to provide method chaining. This operator uses "reactive pull" backpressure to slow down the source observable in case it's over producing. This means the source of data from this stream should support backpressure. The easiest way to do this is to model it as an Iterable or Generator, or if this isn't possible, to use SyncOnSubscribe in the Observable.create method.
        Parameters:
        rightHandSide - the observable to join against
        ordering - a comparator which specifies the relative ordering of both streams
        leftHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        rightHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        joinFunction - a function which join the values from the two streams
        joinType - the type of join to perform -- left, outer, and inner
        Returns:
        the joined observable
